Documentation¶

Functions¶

Tools.load_data(path)¶

Method of loading the data of the trace.

Parameters

path (str) – path

Returns

loaded data

Return type

DataFrame

Tools.smooth_data(data)¶

Smoothing the input data.

Parameters

data (DataFrame) – data

Returns

smoothed data

Return type

DataFrame

Tools.running_average(x, y, window=None)¶

Finding running average of smoothed x and y values.

Parameters

  • x (list or numpy array) – arguments to be smoothed

  • y (list or numpy array) – values to be smoothed

  • window (list or numpy array (default None)) – window

Returns

smoothed x values, smoothed y values

Return type

two numpy arrays

Tools.find_last_range(data, smoothed_data)¶

Finding the approximated range of the last protein state.

Parameters

  • data (DataFrame) – input data

  • smoothed_data (DataFrame) – smoothed input data

Returns

approximated range of the last state

Return type

tuple

Tools.marko_siggia(d, length, p, k=0)¶

Method that computes the value of extended WLC function in a particular point with three parameters: persistence length, force constant and total length of a protein.

Parameters

  • d (float) – the extension of a protein

  • length (float) – expected total length of a protein

  • p (float) – constant (Boltzmann constant times temperature divided by persistence length)

  • k (float) – force constant (default: 0)

Returns

force value in a chosen point of extension

Return type

float

Tools.wlc(distances, length, p, k=0)¶
Parameters

  • distances (array-like) – array of extensions

  • p (float) – constant (Boltzmann constant times temperature divided by persistence length)

  • k (float) – force constant (default: 0)

Returns

array of Marko-Siggia function values

Return type

numpy array

Tools.invert_wlc(force, p, k=0)¶

Inverting the Marko-Siggia function in order to find d/length.

Parameters

  • force – Force value in given point

  • p (float) – constant (Boltzmann constant times temperature divided by persistence length)

  • k (float) – force constant (default: 0)

Returns

d/length value

Return type

float

Tools.to_minimize(x, data, last_range, bond_length, residues)¶

Creating a function to be minimized.

Parameters

  • x (list/array) – two-element array: x[0] is the value of p, x[1] is the value of k

  • data (DataFrame) – input data

  • last_range (tuple) – last range

  • bond_length (float) – bond length

  • residues (int) – number of residues

Returns

vector norm

Return type

int/float

Tools.fit(data, last_range, bond_length, residues, initial_guess, bounds)¶
Parameters

  • data (DataFrame) – input data

  • last_range (tuple) – last range

  • bond_length (float) – bond length

  • residues (int) – number of residues

  • initial_guess (array) – initial parameters

  • bounds (tuple of two tuples) – bounds of parameters

Returns

list of two optimal parameters: p and k

Return type

list

Tools.find_contour_lengths(data, p, k)¶

Finding contour lengths from input data.

Parameters

  • data (DataFrame) – input data

  • p (float) – constant (Boltzmann constant times temperature divided by persistence length)

  • k (float) – force constant (default: 0)

Returns

list of contour lengths

Return type

list

Parameters

  • x (float) – argument of gaussian function

  • height (float) – height of gaussian peak

  • mean (float) – mean of gaussian peak

  • width (float) – width of gaussian peak

Returns

value of gaussian function in point x

Return type

float

The function expects 3*states parameters (height1, center1, width1, height2, center2, width2, … :param x: argument of gaussian function :type x: float

Returns

value of gaussian function in point x

Return type

Tools.decompose_histogram(hist_values, **kwargs)¶

Computing number of states, their mean contour lengths, heights, widths.

Parameters

hist_values (Series) – values of the histogram

Returns

DataFrame with columns: means, widths, heights

Return type

DataFrame

Keyword Arguments

  • significance – (float) the precision of finding maximas

  • states – (int) predicted number of states (default: none)

  • bandwidth – ?

  • begs (list) – list of beginnings of states

Classes and methods¶

Class Trajectory¶

class Trajectory.Trajectory(filename)¶
Trajectory.Trajectory.plot_contour_length_histo(self, position)¶

Pre-plotting contour length histo.

Parameters

position (numpy.ndarray) – position of the plot

Returns

None

Trajectory.Trajectory.plot_fd(self, position)¶

Pre-plotting F(d).

Parameters

position (numpy.ndarray) – position of the plot

Returns

None

Trajectory.Trajectory.plot(self)¶

Creates two subplots: contour length histo and F(d). Saves figure in catalogue ‘/Images’. If the catalogue doesn’t exist, creates one. Name of the image is the same as name of input data (contains its last 4 characters).

Trajectory.Trajectory.results_to_latex(self, data)¶

Method exporting DataFrame to latex. Saves latex table in catalogue ‘Trajectory_tables’.

Parameters

data (DataFrame) – Data to export into latex table.

Trajectory.Trajectory.state_boundaries(self)¶

Finding boundaries of each state. A boundary is defined when WLC fit for each state reaches the value 12. Method changes histo_data field - it adds two new columns: ‘begs’ and ‘ends’. Returns None.

Trajectory.Trajectory.parameters_to_txt(self)¶

Method exporting saving parameters to txt file. Saves table in catalogue ‘p_k_table’.

Trajectory.Trajectory.calculate_work(self)¶

Calculating work done in each state by applying the definition: W = <F> * dx. This method changes the histo-data field by adding one more column: ‘work’.

Concats data from all trajectories into one.

Returns

total data

Return type
